1.summary: This series of tweets is about people from Europe who were born in the early 1900s and suffered under the Holocaust. Six of the people were Jewish and one was Polish. Four of the people were deported to Auschwitz and not survived during the Holocaust. One was shot in the camp and one was deported from Westerbork. There was also a tweet about two minutes of silence to observe the first anniversary of the end of the Great War.
1.title: "Memorializing Victims of Holocaust: A Collection of Tweets"

3.summary: This Thanksgiving, it is important to show gratitude in both personal and professional life. Here are 6 ways to do this at work: Write handwritten notes to colleagues, take your team to lunch, offer personal development opportunities, give a day off if possible, send a gift and surprise a colleague you admire. Small gestures can make a big difference and show that you care and are thankful for the people in your life.
3.title: "Giving Gratitude at Work: 6 Ways to Show Appreciation"

0.summary: Product roadmaps provide an action plan and clear direction for development teams, increased visibility, reduced project detours and a single source of truth. Building a product roadmap involves creating a product strategy based on questions related to the product, its purpose and objectives, as well as who it is intended for. This roadmap should be owned and managed by a product manager who will communicate the product vision and how to execute it. Validation of future features is
0.title: "Building Product Roadmaps: A Guide"

36.summary: Individuals with ADHD or other learning difficulties have found reading to be a challenge. To improve their reading skills, they have been experimenting with Bionic Reading® and PDSA loops to read more efficiently and enjoyably. This has helped them cut their reading time in half, providing them with more time to spend on other activities and gather valuable insights.
36.title: "Finding Balance Through Bionic Reading"

4.summary: Virtual meeting etiquette is important for successful meetings, ensuring that everyone has adequate time to listen and think. Preparation is key - have an agenda, keep note-taking to a minimum, and dress for success - and be respectful of each other's time. Breaks can be helpful in long meetings, and remembering to be kind to one another will make a positive difference.
4.title: "Modern Virtual Meeting Etiquette: 10 Essential Rules"
